column3: terram tuam; āvertistī captīvitātem Jācōbis. ^ Lord
column4: thou hast blessed thy land; thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.

column1: 3 ^ Remīsistī inīquitātem plēbis tuae; operuistī omnia peccāta eōrum. ^ Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people; thou hast covered all their sins.
4 ^ Mītigāvistī omnem īram tuam; āvertistī ab īrā indignātiōnis tuae. ^ Thou hast mitigated all thy anger; thou hast turned away from the wrath of thy indignation.

column3: et āverte īram tuam ā nōbīs. ^ Convert us
column5: and turn off thy anger from us.

column1: 6 ^ Numquid in aeternum īrāsceris nōbīs? Aut extendēs īram tuam ā generātiōne in generātiōnem? ^ Wilt thou be angry with us for ever
column2: or wilt thou extend thy wrath from generation to generation?

column3: et plēbs tua laetābitur in tē. ^ Thou wilt turn
column6: and thy people shall rejoice in thee.

column4: et salūtāre tuum dā nōbīs. ^ Show us

column1: 9 ^ Audiem quid loquātur in mē Dominus Deus
column2: quoniam loquētur pācem in plēbem suam
column4: et in eōs quī convertuntur ad cor. ^ I will hear what the Lord God should speak in me
column5: for he will speak peace unto his people
column7: and unto them that are converted to the heart.

column1: 10 ^ Vērumtamen prope timentēs eum salūtāre ipsīus
column2: ut inhabitet glōria in terrā nostrā. ^ Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him
column3: that glory may dwell in our land.

column1: 11 ^ Misericordia et vēritās obviāvērunt sibi; jūstitia et pāx ōsculātae sunt. ^ Mercy and truth have met each other; justice and peace have kissed.

column2: et jūstitia dē caelō prōspexit. ^ Truth is sprung out of the earth
column3: and justice hath looked down from heaven.

column2: et terra nostra dabit fructum suum. ^ For the Lord will give goodness
column3: and our earth shall yield her fruit.

column2: et pōnet in viā gressūs suōs. ^ Justice shall walk before him
column3: and he shall set his steps in the way.
